sentences.en: But as Kinzer explains, "For most of Turkey's modern history, the Muslim world has seen [the country] as an apostate," having "no religious legitimacy" and acting "as Washington's lackey.
sentences.cn: 但作者认为“在土耳其的现代历史中，穆斯林世界将那时的土耳其视为一种变节，一点没有宗教气节，完全是美国的走狗。”

sentences.en: Extremes meet. the most fur ious anarchist become the most barefaced apostate.
sentences.cn: 两极相通。最激烈的无政府主义者，居然成了最露骨的变节者。

sentences.en: I'm awfully glad you have made an apostate of me all the same!
sentences.cn: 你虽然让我离经叛道,我还是一样地乐不可支!

sentences.en: This religion gives its followers just two options be a terrorist or be an apostate either ways you are dead.
sentences.cn: 宗教给了追随者两个选择，要么当恐怖分子，要么是叛教者。
